stanford.cs106.net

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • stanford.cs106.net.Request

  • public class Request
extends Object
    A Request object encapsulates a basic HTTP request along with its various query parameter key/value pairs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Request(String cmd)
      Constructs a new Request object with the given command verb.
      Request(String cmd, String... parameters)
      Constructs a new Request object with the given command verb and the given set of parameter key/value pairs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addParam(String key)
      Adds a new query parameter with the given name and an empty value.
      void addParam(String key, String value)
      Adds a new query parameter with the given name and value.
      void addParams(String... params)
      Adds new query parameters with the given name/value pairs, passed as a var-args array in the order K1, V1, K2, V2, etc.
      void addRaw(String key, String value)
      Adds a new query parameter with the given name and value.
      static String decode(String str)
      URL-decodes the given string.
      static String encode(String str)
      URL-encodes the given string.
      static Request fromUrl(String url)
      Converts the given string into a Request object, parsing and separating any of its query parameters.
      static Request fromUrl(URL url)
      Converts the given URL into a Request object, parsing and separating any of its query parameters.
      String getCommand()
      Returns this request's HTTP command verb.
      String getParam(String key)
      Returns the value of this request's query parameter with the given name.
      Map<String,String> getParams()
      Returns all of this request's query parameters as a map.
      String getRaw(String key)
      Returns the value of this request's query parameter with the given name.
      boolean hasParam(String key)
      Returns true if this request contains a query parameter with the given name.
      void removeParam(String key)
      Removes the query parameter with the given name from this request.
      String toGetRequest()
      Converts this request into a URL string that could be used for an HTTP GET request, such as "http://server:port/verb?param1=value1¶m2=value2...¶mN=valueN".
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this request for debugging.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public static String decode(String str)
        URL-decodes the given string.

      • encode

        public static String encode(String str)
        URL-encodes the given string.

      • fromUrl

        public static Request fromUrl(String url)
        Converts the given string into a Request object, parsing and separating any of its query parameters.

      • fromUrl

        public static Request fromUrl(URL url)
        Converts the given URL into a Request object, parsing and separating any of its query parameters.

      • addParam

        public void addParam(String key)
        Adds a new query parameter with the given name and an empty value.

      • addParam

        public void addParam(String key,
                     String value)
        Adds a new query parameter with the given name and value.

      • addParams

        public void addParams(String... params)
        Adds new query parameters with the given name/value pairs, passed as a var-args array in the order K1, V1, K2, V2, etc.

      • addRaw

        public void addRaw(String key,
                   String value)
        Adds a new query parameter with the given name and value. The value is not URL-encoded before including it.

      • getCommand

        public String getCommand()
        Returns this request's HTTP command verb.

      • getParam

        public String getParam(String key)
        Returns the value of this request's query parameter with the given name. The parameter value is URL-decoded before returning it. If the request contains no such parameter, returns null.

      • getParams

        public Map<String,String> getParams()
        Returns all of this request's query parameters as a map. The map returned is immutable and cannot be directly modified. If the request contains no parameters, returns an empty map.

      • getRaw

        public String getRaw(String key)
        Returns the value of this request's query parameter with the given name. The parameter value is *not* URL-decoded before returning it. If the request contains no such parameter, returns null.

      • hasParam

        public boolean hasParam(String key)
        Returns true if this request contains a query parameter with the given name.

      • removeParam

        public void removeParam(String key)
        Removes the query parameter with the given name from this request. If no such query parameter was present, has no effect.

      • toGetRequest

        public String toGetRequest()
        Converts this request into a URL string that could be used for an HTTP GET request, such as "http://server:port/verb?param1=value1¶m2=value2...¶mN=valueN".

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this request for debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
